title: I miss that group shield the inner towers had in S5. Why are we allowed 0 actual comeback mechanics?
body: At first I thought the turret shield and laser turrets were kinda broken, but then you see the alternative now watching tanks eat 30+ shots and there's no way that's healthier or more fun. Can we go back to a time of our bases having actual defenses at 20+minutes again please?

Out of curiosity why do people think comebacks should always be an option?  The team that gets the advantage early should always have a very high chance to win the game.  And if your complaint about that is "but what about late game champs?"  Should late game champs not come with the disadvantage of losing to early game champs snowballing the game?  Comebacks should be rare, they should not be an every game thing while the enemy team is playing well.

It's not that people believe they should have the opportunity to win any game at any time. It's a matter of having an actual viable strategy to turn to if you fall behind, not just hope for an enemy throw. Not that I agree with the OP on this one in particular, but snowballing does have to be kept in check. When it's too easy to snowball, games suffer.

And on the flipside bot lane getting dumpstered, but Twitch finishing 2 items with an Ardent support shouldn't automatically win them the game in a "comeback" since he just afk sat bottom while the rest of his team lost everything.

Don't get me wrong I'm not saying the tower shield was the perfect mechanic for turnarounds, but the idea was at least pretty creative imo. You hit the nail on the head with that part though, you basically just beg for 20 minutes that 3 enemies make a huge mistake at the same time for a reverse sweep.

You are contradicting yourself here.  "its not that people believe they should have the opportunity to win any game at any time," and "its a matter of having an actual viable strategy to turn if you fall behind."  An actual viable strategy entails that it works consistently.  
What you want are consistent ways to win from behind, the game isnt supposed to work like that.  You are supposed to get a lead and win the game with that said lead, comebacks have always happened when the winning team begins to throw.

I'm not contradicting myself, or even disagreeing with you, I'm answering your original question, because I'm not really sure why you are curious and have to ask that in the first place. 

There's a big difference between falling behind after a series of interactions and being likely to lose (perfectly fair), and going down 1 kill and not having real options to compete for the next X number of minutes (situation OP was talking about with respect to towers). 

Getting a kill early in lane should give you a definite advantage (experience+item components for instance). No one's debating that this isn't fair. But there has to be some opportunity for the one who died to tie up the score if they outplay. However things like towers offering very little protection don't give you that agency to do so, and that's an issue in some patches. Many players frequently state that it's not fun to play a 30min game where 80+% of the meaningful play happens in the first 10. 

Also, comeback mechanics =/= anyone can win at any time

You're actually afforded two comeback mechanics. Shutdown gold and minions auto-pushing towards the team that is behind. Its just the team that is ahead can try to make a play and capitalize on their advantage now. Previously, the shield made it so that:

1) Defending team was highly incentivised and empowered to turtle up under their towers and waveclear non-stop.

2) Attacking team was highly discouraged to make any real push and instead focus solely on taking enemy jungle camps.

Basically, it encouraged both teams NOT to make plays and just led to games stalling out.

> Why are we allowed 0 actual comeback mechanics?

Why should negations of good choices be allowed?
I hated the "comeback" mechanics of just turtling in prior seasons, which would shut down any of the consequences of my good choices in the early game, and gave "worse" players the options to stall the game until they just stat check me on the merit of both teams having full item builds.

Comebacks should be the result of good choices by the deficient team, not from game systems that give deficient teams mercy handicaps.
In order for good choices to work then they need to be powerful enough to counteract a stat advantage.
Or the built-in mechanics of the game that suppress the effects of good choices could be toned down.

I feel like you don't even understand the game in the meta we are in right now. If there were really 0 comeback mechanics, we would see everyone drafting winning lanes and snowballing. But season 7 has been almost solely tanks, enchanter supports, and hypercarry adc's for lategame teamfights. I understand it's not fun to lose when the enemy team just snowballs on you, but you can't just deny facts because you lost a couple games to some early game champs that snowballed and did their job right.

Cause nowdays "late game hypercarries" can reach their potential much earlier compared to before. An ADC can be considered fed by the 15 min mark compared to before when an ADC needed around 30 min to be considered fed.
Tanks never die chief, they merely regenerate to full HP with their warmogs 8 seconds later and come back for round two.
I wish it was that easy in plat, tanks die in 3 seconds flat up here. Just because you don't know how to play against them doesn't make them op.

Mostly due to Riot not wanting the meta to turn into "turtle for 20 mins and wait for comeback" i guess they wanted us to go out and make plays for the come back, but i do agree game is too snowbally right now.
